document.topic_text: Irvin Zacek After a brief and unexpected illness, our beloved Dad and PawPaw, Irvin Zacek, was called to his heavenly home on Thursday, April 21, 2016, surrounded by his loving family. Irvin was born in Pierce to Edmund and Hattie Zacek on March 7, 1934. He married the love of his life, Dorothy Gregory, on Nov. 20, 1952. One of Dad’s highlights during those early years was being the Ganado farmer who brought in the first bale of cotton in 1963. In 1968, he took a job with The Dow Chemical Company, where he worked until his retirement in 1996. kAmxCG:? =@G65 =:DE6?:?8 E@ 2== <:?5D @7 >FD:4[ 3FE A@=<2 >FD:4 2?5 v6@C86 y@?6D H6C6 EH@ @7 9:D 72G@C:E6D] (96? 96 H@F=5 86E 2 ?6H rs[ 96 2=H2JD 925 @?6 @C EH@ D@?8D E@ D92C6 H:E9 9:D 49:=5C6? 2?5 8C2?549:=5C6? document.post: Irvin Zacek After a brief and unexpected illness, our beloved Dad and PawPaw, Irvin Zacek, was called to his heavenly home on Thursday, April 21, 2016, surrounded by his loving family. Irvin was born in Pierce to Edmund and Hattie Zacek on March 7, 1934. He married the love of his life, Dorothy Gregory, on Nov. 20, 1952. One of Dad’s highlights during those early years was being the Ganado farmer who brought in the first bale of cotton in 1963.
